summary: Completed comprehensive testing of Village Friends advanced search filters feature. All backend API tests passed (14/14). Frontend filter UI working correctly with filter toggle, age range slider, interest selection, apply/clear filters, and active filter tags.

ui_bugs.issue: Slider component only exposes 1 thumb element for automation instead of 2 (min/max). Functionality works correctly via manual interaction.
ui_bugs.details: The shadcn Slider component's internal structure makes it difficult to programmatically adjust both min and max values separately. This is a minor automation concern, not a user-facing bug.

passed_tests: Backend: API root accessible
Backend: Nearby families without filters returns list
Backend: min_age filter correctly filters families with kids >= specified age
Backend: max_age filter correctly filters families with kids <= specified age
Backend: Age range filter (min_age + max_age) works correctly
Backend: Single interest filter returns families with matching interest
Backend: Multiple interests filter returns families with any matching interest
Backend: Combined age + interest filters work together
Backend: Radius filter affects results
Backend: Empty/restrictive filters return empty list gracefully
Backend: Invalid age params handled gracefully
Backend: Young kids filter (0-7) finds Creative Family (ages 4,6)
Backend: Teens filter (14-18) finds Active Family (ages 14,16)
Backend: Middle school filter (8-12) finds STEM Family (ages 9,11)
Frontend: Filter toggle button expands/collapses filter panel
Frontend: Age range slider visible and interactive
Frontend: Interest buttons selectable (Science, Sports, etc.)
Frontend: Multiple interests can be selected
Frontend: Clear Filters button resets all filters
Frontend: Apply Filters button triggers search with selected filters
Frontend: Active filters display as removable tags below search bar
Frontend: Filter indicator dot shows when filters are applied
seed_data_creation: Test user created during API testing with family profile. Existing test families used: Creative Family (ages 4,6), Active Family (ages 14,16), STEM Family (ages 9,11)
context_for_next_testing_agent: Advanced search filters feature fully tested and working. Backend API /api/families/nearby accepts min_age, max_age, and interests parameters. Frontend Discover page has expandable filter panel with age slider and interest buttons. All data-testid attributes present: filter-toggle-btn, age-range-slider, interest-{name}, clear-filters-btn, apply-filters-btn. Test families exist with various ages for filter testing.
